str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
And, even, also, namely.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
And, even, also, namely.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
And, even, also, namely.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
And, even, also, namely.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
And, even, also, namely.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
